laboratory_examinations.findings: Hematocrit of 33%, indicative of mild normocytic anemia.
Left temporal and left central slow wave activity suggestive of localized cortical injury, rare left temporal interictal epileptiform discharges.
Captured a seizure at onset showing low-voltage fast and ultrafast activity over the left anterior-mesial-frontal region.
Captured multiple seizures showing bicentral high-amplitude spike and wave discharge.
Normal in 1.5-T MRI; Mild diffuse cerebellar atrophy and slightly enlarged right temporal horn found in 3.0-T MRI.
Slight decreases in N-acetylaspartate concentrations in the left mesial temporal region, suggestive of loss of neuronal elements.
Decrease in right temporal lobe use of fluorodeoxyglucose, suggestive of decreased metabolic activity.
Moderate difficulty with frontal lobe executive functioning (right greater than left).
